channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
channel.desc: Top criminal barristers Sasha Wass QC and Jeremy Dein QC re-examine an infamous case of a housewife accused of murdering her young husband. She became the last woman to be publicly hanged in Dorset, and her story inspired a legendary novel. Dorset, 1856. In the early hours of the 6th of July, Martha Brown, a resident of Birdsmoorgate in rural Dorset, called on her neighbour begging for help.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents from Warwickshire's Ragley Hall, a 17th-century Palladian house. Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Charlie Ross find a selection of antiques and collectibles to take to auction. Christina gets to grips with a weighty Jardinere, Charlie tests out a horse-measuring stick on its owner and Paul Martin steps into the world of folk art.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Former winners Mark Chapman, Will Kirk, Amanda Lamb and Rachel Parris take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson is joined by sporting legend Tanni Grey-Thompson in Northumberland's Kielder Forest. They share a bicycle ride on the shores of Kielder Water, and Tanni takes a leap outside of her comfort zone on an accessible zip wire course.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: A ruinous farmhouse and sheds in St. Mullins, County Carlow are lovingly brought back to life as a first home for a young couple.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: It might be isolated, but Ramsey Island has enough attractions to ensure inhabitants stay here all year around, with seals to spot, surfing and plenty of sheep.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: The crew at Wick begin a frantic search to find a paddleboarder who has drifted a mile out to sea, while her family wait anxiously on the shore. Further south, the Fraserburgh crew respond to a mayday call from a trawler that has run aground.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: After a brutal hammer attack in Telford, West Mercia Police have a 31-year-old man in custody. The man's attack on his family has left his mother dead. Detectives investigate his behaviour leading up to the attack.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: As the excitement for 2025's Glastonbury Festival reaches fever pitch, this is the ultimate 90s throwback, a look at some of the biggest hits from the decade performed over the years at Worthy Farm.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
channel.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBC's range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.
